description.narrative: Consortium partners in Senegal will focus on building transversal movements by bringing different organizations and constituencies together to share experiences and knowledge (Pathway 1). This will also involve establishing and strengthening links between community-based organizations and national platforms, facilitating their involvement to promote inclusive policies. The consortium will strive to raise awareness and build the capacity of youth groups, women's groups and community organizations on climate change and climate justice, through public awareness and advocacy campaigns, and through trainings and dialogues that promote civic actions by young people (Pathway 2). In addition, the AACJ programme in Senegal will support the valorisation, sharingand dissemination of existingcommunity good practices for climate adaptation and mitigation through publications, video, events and fairs (Pathway 4). The consortium strengthens capacities of impacted communities to denounce violations, initiate strategic climate justice litigation and challenge actions that violate their environmental and social rights (Pathway 3). The Programme will promote corporate accountability andpolicy changes for just transition policies on renewable energies and a reductionof fossil fuel dependence (Pathway 5). The programme will also promote and support the representation and inclusion of community voices in policy spaces at national, regional and global level, and lobbying and advocating.

participating-org.narrative:
Oxfam is working in Senegal since 1981 and has opened a first office in Senegal in 1983. Oxfam in Senegal is implementing a 5-year country strategy (2015-2019) which is articulated around the following vision which is:
Senegal has an active citizenry,comprising of a good representation of men, women and youth, that is willing and capable of influencing the development and implementation of national policies, and receives a more equitable share of the national wealth.
The country strategy uses a two-tiered approach: - to promote citizen participation in policy formulation and implementation processes; - To promote innovativefield programming that addresses the immediate needs of the poorest segments of society while strengthening their capacity to influence local authorities.
This strategy focusses on sustainable livelihoods, promoting good governance and humanitarian (contributingto strengthening the leadership of local actors in the context of integrated disaster management, from prevention to emergency response). It also recognizes the under-utilized potentialities and power of some marginalized groups, especially women and youth.
Oxfam in Senegal adheres to six partnership principles: shared vision and values,mutual accountability, complementarity, clarity of roles, institutional autonomy, and commitment to joint learning, and is carrying out projects through partnering with local NGOs and organisations (such as producer#s organisations).

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood
